name: Chicken Adobo
instructions: 1. In a large bowl, combine chicken, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves, and peppercorns. Marinate for at least 30 minutes. 2. Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Add marinated chicken and sear until lightly browned. 3. Pour in marinade and add water. Bring to a boil, then lower heat and simmer for 30–40 minutes until chicken is tender. 4. Adjust seasoning, simmer until sauce thickens slightly, and serve hot with rice.

name: Pork Adobo
instructions: 1. Combine pork, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves, and peppercorns in a bowl. Marinate for at least 30 minutes. 2. Heat oil in a pot, add marinated pork, and cook until lightly browned. 3. Pour in marinade and water. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 45 minutes until pork is tender. 4. Reduce sauce to desired thickness, adjust seasoning, and serve with rice.

name: Beef Caldereta
instructions: 1. Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic until fragrant. 2. Add beef and brown on all sides. 3. Stir in tomato sauce and beef broth. Simmer for 1.5 to 2 hours or until beef is tender. 4. Add potatoes, carrots, and bell peppers. Cook until vegetables are tender. 5. Stir in liver spread and green peas, mix well, and season with salt and pepper before serving.

name: Kare-Kare
ingredients: 1 packet kare-kare mix or 1/2 cup peanut butter
instructions: 1. Boil oxtail and tripe in a large pot until tender, skimming off scum. Set aside meat and reserve broth. 2. In a separate pot, heat oil and sauté onion and garlic until fragrant. 3. Add the boiled meat and stir well. 4. Pour in beef broth and peanut butter (or kare-kare mix). Stir until sauce thickens. 5. Add vegetables and cook until tender. 6. Serve hot with bagoong on the side.

name: Sinigang na Baboy
ingredients: 1 kg pork belly or ribs (cut into serving pieces)
Salt and fish sauce to taste
instructions: 1. In a pot, boil water and add pork, removing scum as it rises. 2. Add tomatoes and onion, simmer for 45 minutes or until pork is tender. 3. Add radish and green chili, cook for 3 minutes. 4. Add sinigang mix (or fresh tamarind juice) and season with fish sauce or salt. 5. Add kangkong last, turn off heat, and serve hot.

name: Sinigang na Hipon
instructions: 1. Bring water to a boil in a pot. Add tomatoes and onion, simmer for 5 minutes. 2. Add radish and green chili, cook until radish is slightly tender. 3. Add sinigang mix and season with fish sauce. 4. Add shrimp and cook for 2–3 minutes until pink. 5. Add kangkong leaves, turn off heat, and serve.

name: Tinolang Manok
ingredients: Fish sauce and pepper to taste
instructions: 1. Heat oil in a pot, sauté onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. 2. Add chicken pieces and cook until lightly browned. 3. Pour in water, bring to a boil, then simmer for 30 minutes or until chicken is tender. 4. Add green papaya and cook until soft. 5. Season with fish sauce and pepper, add chili leaves, and turn off heat.

name: Bulalo
ingredients: 1 kg beef shank with bone marrow
2 corn on the cob (cut into pieces)
instructions: 1. In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add beef shank and onion, removing scum that forms on top. 2. Simmer for 2–3 hours until beef is very tender. 3. Add corn and cook for 10 minutes. 4. Add green beans and pechay, cook for 3–5 minutes. 5. Season with salt and pepper before serving.

name: Laing
ingredients: Salt and shrimp paste to taste
instructions: 1. In a pot, combine coconut milk, onion, garlic, ginger, and pork belly. Bring to a gentle boil and simmer for 10 minutes. 2. Add taro leaves without stirring (to prevent itchiness), cover, and cook for 15 minutes. 3. Pour in coconut cream, add chilies, and simmer until leaves are tender. 4. Season with shrimp paste or salt, and serve with rice.

name: Bicol Express
instructions: 1. In a pan, cook pork belly until lightly browned. 2. Add onion, garlic, and shrimp paste, sauté for 2 minutes. 3. Pour in coconut milk and simmer for 20 minutes until pork is tender. 4. Add chilies and coconut cream, simmer until sauce thickens. 5. Adjust seasoning and serve hot.

name: Pinakbet
instructions: 1. Sauté pork, onion, and garlic in a pan until pork is cooked. 2. Add tomatoes and cook until soft. 3. Stir in shrimp paste and water. 4. Add squash first, then after 5 minutes add bitter melon, eggplant, and string beans. 5. Cover and simmer until vegetables are tender. Adjust seasoning and serve.

name: La Paz Batchoy
instructions: 1. Boil pork bones for broth, then simmer for 1.5 hours. 2. In a separate pot, sauté onion and garlic, add pork meat and liver, cook until done. 3. Add pork intestines and pork broth, season with fish sauce. 4. Add noodles and cook for 3 minutes. 5. Serve topped with chicharon and chopped spring onions.

name: Pancit Canton
instructions: 1. Soak noodles in water until softened, drain and set aside. 2. Heat oil, sauté garlic and onion. Add pork and cook until browned. 3. Add shrimp and cook until pink. 4. Add carrot and cabbage, cook for 2 minutes. 5. Add soy sauce and chicken broth, bring to a boil. 6. Add noodles, toss to combine and cook for 3 minutes. Serve hot.

name: Pancit Malabon
ingredients: Chopped green onions and crushed chicharon for garnish
instructions: 1. Boil noodles until tender, drain and set aside. 2. Sauté garlic and onion in annatto oil. Add shrimp and cook until pink. 3. Pour in shrimp broth and fish sauce, bring to a boil. 4. Add noodles and toss to coat evenly with sauce. 5. Transfer to serving plate, top with smoked fish flakes, egg slices, green onions, and chicharon.

name: Puto
instructions: 1. Mix rice flour, sugar, and baking powder. Gradually add coconut milk and mix until smooth. 2. Pour batter into molds, top with cheese slices. 3. Steam for 15–20 minutes or until set. 4. Remove from steamer and cool before serving.

name: Lechon Kawali
instructions: 1. Boil pork belly with salt and pepper until tender, about 1 hour. 2. Drain and pat dry. 3. Deep fry pork belly in hot oil until skin is crispy. 4. Slice and serve with lechon sauce.

name: Halo-Halo
instructions: 1. In a tall glass, layer sweetened beans, nata de coco, saba, and jackfruit. 2. Add shaved ice on top. 3. Pour evaporated milk over the ice. 4. Top with a scoop of ube ice cream and serve immediately.

name: Chicken Inasal
instructions: 1. Marinate chicken in calamansi juice, soy sauce, garlic, brown sugar, annatto oil, salt, and pepper for at least 4 hours. 2. Grill chicken over charcoal, basting with marinade until cooked and slightly charred. 3. Serve with steamed rice and dipping sauce.

name: Laing (Dry Version)
instructions: 1. Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant. 2. Add dried shrimp and sauté for 2 minutes. 3. Pour in coconut milk and bring to a boil. 4. Add taro leaves and chilies, simmer uncovered until coconut milk reduces and leaves are tender. 5. Season with salt and serve.

name: Chicken Longganisa
instructions: 1. Mix ground chicken, garlic, brown sugar, salt, pepper, vinegar, and paprika thoroughly. 2. Shape into small sausage links using casings or form patties and wrap in wax paper. 3. Fry in a pan until cooked through and browned. Serve with garlic rice and eggs.

name: Pancit Palabok
ingredients: Chicharon, boiled eggs, green onions, and crushed garlic for toppings
instructions: 1. Boil rice noodles until soft, drain and set aside. 2. Sauté garlic and onion in annatto oil. 3. Add shrimp and cook until pink. 4. Add pork liver and shrimp broth, simmer. 5. Pour sauce over noodles, mix gently. 6. Garnish with chicharon, boiled eggs, green onions, and crushed garlic before serving.

name: Arroz Caldo
ingredients: Chopped green onions and fried garlic for garnish
instructions: 1. Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant. 2. Add chicken and cook until lightly browned. 3. Add rice and stir to coat grains. 4. Pour in chicken broth, bring to boil then simmer until rice is soft and porridge-like. 5. Season with fish sauce. 6. Serve hot garnished with green onions, fried garlic, and calamansi.

name: Pork Menudo
instructions: 1. Sauté onion and garlic until fragrant. 2. Add pork and cook until browned. 3. Stir in tomato sauce, water, and liver spread. Simmer until pork is tender. 4. Add potatoes, carrots, and bell pepper. Cook until vegetables are soft. 5. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

name: Ginataang Sitaw at Kalabasa
ingredients: 1 bundle sitaw (string beans, cut into 2-inch pieces)
instructions: 1. Heat oil, sauté onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. 2. Add kalabasa and cook for 5 minutes. 3. Pour in coconut milk and simmer until kalabasa is tender. 4. Add sitaw and cook until beans are tender. 5. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

name: Tapsilog
instructions: 1. Pan-fry beef tapa until cooked and caramelized. 2. Fry eggs sunny side up or to preference. 3. Serve tapa and eggs with garlic rice. Season with salt and pepper.

name: Calamares
ingredients: Garlic mayo or vinegar for dipping
instructions: 1. Mix flour, salt, and pepper in a bowl. 2. Coat squid rings with flour mixture. 3. Deep fry squid rings in hot oil until golden brown. 4. Drain excess oil and serve hot with dipping sauce and calamansi.

name: Puto Bumbong
instructions: 1. Steam soaked rice in bamboo tubes (traditional) or molds until cooked. 2. Remove and top with butter, grated coconut, and brown sugar. 3. Serve warm.

name: Ensaymada
ingredients: Cheese slices and sugar for topping
instructions: 1. Dissolve yeast in warm milk. 2. Mix flour, sugar, yeast mixture, and eggs to form dough. 3. Knead dough, add butter, and let rise until doubled. 4. Shape dough into rounds, bake at 350°F (175°C) for 15 minutes. 5. Brush with butter, sprinkle sugar and cheese before serving.

name: Laing (Wet Version)
ingredients: Salt and shrimp paste to taste
instructions: 1. In a pot, combine coconut milk, onion, garlic, ginger, and pork belly. Bring to a gentle boil and simmer for 10 minutes. 2. Add taro leaves without stirring (to prevent itchiness), cover, and cook for 15 minutes. 3. Pour in coconut cream, add chilies, and simmer until leaves are tender. 4. Season with shrimp paste or salt, and serve with rice.

name: Menudo
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add pork and cook until lightly browned.
Stir in tomato sauce and liver spread, simmer for 20 minutes.
Add potatoes, carrots, and bell pepper, cook until tender.
Stir in green peas, season with salt and pepper, then serve.

name: Chicken Afritada
instructions: Heat oil in a pot, sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add chicken and brown on all sides.
Pour in tomato sauce and water/broth, simmer for 30 minutes.
Add potatoes, carrots, and bell peppers, cook until tender.
Season with salt and pepper, then serve hot.

name: Calamansi Juice
instructions: Squeeze calamansi juice into a pitcher, removing seeds.
Add sugar and water, stir until sugar dissolves.
Add ice cubes and serve chilled.

name: Turon (Banana Spring Rolls)
instructions: Roll banana slices in brown sugar.
Wrap in spring roll wrappers and seal edges with water.
Fry in hot oil until golden and crisp.
Drain excess oil and serve warm.

name: Buko Pandan Salad
instructions: In a bowl, mix shredded coconut, pandan jelly, and nata de coco.
Combine condensed milk and cream, then pour over the mixture.
Stir well and chill before serving.

name: Bibingka
ingredients: Grated coconut and salted egg slices for topping
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Mix rice flour, sugar, and baking powder.
Add eggs and coconut milk, whisk until smooth.
Pour batter into banana leaf-lined molds or baking pans.
Bake for 20-25 minutes until cooked through.
Top with grated coconut and salted egg slices, serve warm.

name: Leche Flan
instructions: Caramelize sugar in a pan until golden and pour into molds.
Mix egg yolks, condensed milk, evaporated milk, and vanilla extract.
Pour mixture into molds over caramel.
Steam for 30-40 minutes until set.
Cool and refrigerate before serving.

name: Paksiw na Pata
instructions: Boil pork hock until tender, drain and set aside.
In a pot, combine vinegar, soy sauce, water, garlic, onion, peppercorns, and brown sugar.
Add pork and banana slices, simmer for 30 minutes.
Season with salt to taste, serve warm.

name: Ginataang Langka
instructions: Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add shrimp or pork and cook until done.
Add jackfruit and coconut milk, bring to a simmer.
Season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper.
Add chili peppers, cook until jackfruit is tender.
Serve hot.

name: Tokwa’t Baboy
ingredients: 200g firm tofu (fried and cut into cubes)
instructions: Mix soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, garlic, and onions in a bowl.
Add pork and tofu cubes, toss to coat.
Season with salt and pepper, garnish with green onions.
Serve as appetizer or pulutan.

name: Okoy
ingredients: 1 cup sweet potato or regular potato (julienned)
Vinegar with garlic and chili (for dipping)
instructions: In a bowl, mix flour, cornstarch, water, and egg until batter forms.
Add shrimps, sweet potato, onion, garlic, salt, and pepper; mix well.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
Scoop spoonfuls of the mixture and fry until golden brown and crispy.
Drain excess oil on paper towels.
Serve hot with vinegar dipping sauce.
